byline.original: By AMY HAIMERL and ABBY GOODNOUGH
byline.contributor: Amy Haimerl reported from Flint, and Abby Goodnough from Washington. Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Prosecutors in Michigan filed charges against six state workers on Friday, bringing to nine the number charged after lead leached into the water system in Flint.

headline.print_headline: 6 More State Workers Charged Over Flint Water Crisis
headline.main: 6 More State Workers Charged in Flint Water Crisis

snippet: Prosecutors in Michigan filed charges against six state workers on Friday, bringing to nine the number charged after lead leached into the water system in Flint....
abstract: Michigan prosecutors file charges against six additional government workers for their role in water contamination crisis in city of Flint; workers are accused of concealing information about lead in city's drinking water supply; State Atty Gen Bill Schuette suggests charges of higher-level officials could follow.
